detroit lion profession american footbal team base detroit, michigan. member nfc north divis nation footbal confer (nfc) nation footbal leagu (nfl), play home game ford field downtown detroit. origin base portsmouth, ohio call portsmouth spartans, team began play 1928 independ profession team.[1] 2015 season 86th nfl. lion four nfl championships, tie 9th overal total championship amongst 32 nfl franchises; although last 1957, give club second-longest nfl championship drought behind arizona cardinals. lion franchis finish full (non-strik shortened) regular season win tie sinc move sixteen season game 1978, go 0–16 2008 nfl season. also one four current teams, one nfc, never play super bowl. content 1 season 2 refer 3 note 4 see also seasons[edit] note: finish, wins, losses, tie column list regular season result exclud postseason play. italic number mean record subject chang week due regular season postseason game played. nfl champion (1950–1969) super bowl champion (1970–present) confer champion divis champion wild card berth one-gam playoff berth nfl season team' season leagu confer divis regular season post season result award finish win loss tie portsmouth spartan 1930 1930 nfl 8th 5 6 3 nfl hold playoff game 1932 1931 1931 nfl 2nd 11 3 0 1932 1932 nfl 3rd[note 1] 6 2 4 lost playoff game bears, 9-0 1933 1933 nfl western 2nd 6 5 0 detroit lion 1934 1934 nfl western 2nd 10 3 0 1935 1935 nfl western 1st 7 3 2 nfl championship (1) (giants) 26–7 1936 1936 nfl western 3rd 8 4 0 1937 1937 nfl western 2nd (t) 7 4 0 1938 1938 nfl western 2nd 7 4 0 1939 1939 nfl western 3rd 6 5 0 1940 1940 nfl western 3rd 5 5 1 1941 1941 nfl western 3rd 4 6 1 1942 1942 nfl western 5th 0 11 0 1943 1943 nfl western 3rd 3 6 1 1944 1944 nfl western 2nd (t) 6 3 1 frank sinkwich (mvp) 1945 1945 nfl western 2nd 7 3 0 1946 1946 nfl western 5th 1 10 0 1947 1947 nfl western 5th 3 9 0 1948 1948 nfl western 5th 2 10 0 1949 1949 nfl western 4th 4 8 0 1950 1950 nfl nation 4th 6 6 0 1951 1951 nfl nation 2nd (t) 7 4 1 1952 1952 nfl nation 1st (t) 9 3 0 nation confer playoff (rams) 31–21 nfl championship (2) (browns) 17–7 1953 1953 nfl western 1st 10 2 0 nfl championship (3) (browns) 17–16 1954 1954 nfl western 1st 9 2 1 lost nfl championship (browns) 56–10 1955 1955 nfl western 6th 3 9 0 1956 1956 nfl western 2nd 9 3 0 1957 1957 nfl western 1st 8 4 0 western confer playoff (49ers) 31–27 nfl championship (4) (browns) 59–14 georg wilson (coy) 1958 1958 nfl western 5th 4 7 1 1959 1959 nfl western 5th 3 8 1 1960 1960 nfl western 2nd (t) 7 5 0 1961 1961 nfl western 2nd 8 5 1 1962 1962 nfl farr (oroy) lem barney (droy) 1968 1968 nfl western central 4th 4 8 2 earl mccullouch (oroy) 1969 1969 nfl western central 2nd 9 4 1 1970 1970 nfl nfc central 2nd 10 4 0 lost division playoff playoffs) references[edit] "detroit lion history". cb sportsline. retriev may 2008.&#160; "detroit lion history". footbal @ jt-sw.com. john m. troan. retriev april 2012.&#160; ^ "the portsmouth spartans" (pdf). retriev septemb 28, 2013.&#160; notes[edit] ^ finish tie 1st (bi win percentage) 6-1-4; lost tiebreak playoff game bears, drop 3rd place (bi win percentage). tiebreak game consid regular season game, 3rd place 6-2-4 spartan' final standing. ^ due strike-shorten season 1982, team rank confer instead division. see also[edit] histori detroit lion v e detroit lion formerli portsmouth spartan (1930–1933) found 1930 base detroit, michigan headquart allen park, michigan franchis franchis histori season player first-round draft pick start quarterback coach stadium univers playoff game curs bobbi layn mike utley give thumb "take wind" "fire millen" 0–16 "calvin johnson rule" miracl motown rivalri chicago bear green bay packer minnesota vike notabl peopl william clay &amp; martha fireston ford barri sander bobbi layn glenn presnel leagu championship (4) 1935 1952 1953 1957 current leagu affili league: nation footbal leagu conference: nation footbal confer division: north divis broadcast radio detroit lion radio network dan miller jim brandstatt toni ortiz wjr tv detroit lion televis network matt shepard rob rubick nate burleson jennif hammond wjbk fox sport detroit &#160; season (87) 1930 1930 1931 1932 1933 1934 1935 1936 1937 1938 1939 1940 1940 1941 1942 1943 1944 1945 1946 1947 1948 1949 1950 1950 1951 1952 1953 1954 1955 1956 1957 1958 1959
